availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Cadwallader Lewis (Franklin Co, KY Baptist minister)

body.p: Residence: Franklin County, Kentucky. A Virginia-born Baptist minister. Born in Spotsylvania County, Virginia. Married Elizabeth H. Father of William J. Lewis and Mary P. Lewis. Held eight African Americans in slavery, according to 1860 slave census schedules.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, Forks of Elk Horn post office, p. 4.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 2.

Find A Grave, Entry for Rev Cadwallader Lewis (1811-1882), Find A Grave Memorial # 73678702, Frankfort Cemetery, Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=LEW&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSsr=801&GRid=73678702& (accessed 14 Aug 2017).
